page.title: 17Transport:
page.content: Five miles from Langwathby is the M6 and the A6.They take us south to the industrial Midlands.The A6 then A74 take us to Central Scotland.The main North/South passenger and freight line is five miles away at Penrith.Our local line is the scenic Settle to Carlisle line.This 119 year old line is 72 miles long running through the Eden valley.It can only take diesel or steam trains.There are four passenger and two frieght trains each day. N0 trains stop as the station closed in 1970.We are trying to save this lovely line as a tourist attraction and a working railway.Most weekends steam trains use the line.The school has hired steam trains twice for trips.We have done a survey in Langwathby to find out the viability of running a shopper and commuter train to Carlisle owing to bus cuts.RESULTS-90% For.
